body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...] -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3526136/143797422-408c76ae-0f69-4931-a9e1-49cb7361d2f4.png)

Logs are full of various kinds of "fail".  I'm a beginner.  Is this thing working at all?  Am I wasting my and everyone else's time?  I'm probably doing something wrong.  If not, perhaps it would be nice if the logs said something to the effect that "all is reasonably good". 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
Perhaps it would be nice if the logs periodically said something to the effect that "all is reasonably good.  You have some node-connectivity failures, but this level of those is to be expected.". 
Or indicate some of those fails as INFO.
Or for each kind of "fail", add a link to an explainer. 
Or, catch that error; test if have enough good connections; if enough, say INFO OK; if not, throw ERROR. 
Something like that. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
Ethereum.   (Just kidding.)

**Additional context**
<!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
Note, I'm not looking for any feedback on these errors.  I'll google them and figure it out.
title: i feel like a failure
